data.title: Dive Burger Heaven
data.text: If you want a burger and some chips, stop in for lunch. Blue-collar-dive-burger-gods blessed this joint. If you want fancy, options, environment, or to pay with a card then suck it. Not here ladies and gents. If you want a damn good "just a burger", then come in grease on your shirt and all. Slide in during the lunch rush and get back to work!

data.title: Excellent Hamburger
data.text: Best Hamburger I've every had. Next time in Montgomery, AL I will definitely be stopping by. Thanks Hamburger King. All the way from Los Angeles, CA

data.title: Very good hamburger.
data.text: The burger is better than most any that you will find at the chain restaurants across america. The small building could use some better air conditioning,  but it is worth battling that heat in Alabama "that day I went was 107 heat index". They have one thing on the menu for the most part, and they do that one thing well. Very good burgers, and the prices are very affordable.  Would eat here rather often if it weren't 11 hours away from home.

data.title: Best Fresh Hamburgers in Town
data.text: I have lived in Montgomery about 16 years and have been a huge fan of Hamburger King ever since I had my first greasy burger from there.  From the outside you would never realize the tasty goodness that comes from that flat top griddle where the freshly made hamburgers are prepared.  If you want a great hamburger you have to try this place.  Every ingredient is fresh and the service is great.  Just be prepared to wait if you are not there early and have plenty of napkins.  Also they have great breakfast sandwiches

data.title: Exceptional hamburgers!
data.text: This isn't a fast-food stand, so sit back and wait after you place your order. If you go during rush hour, it's going to take 10 to 15 minutes to get your patty on that sizzling grill, but it is SOOOO worth the wait. They start the day with a breakfast menu and then transition into lunch. Walk in and prepare for an aromatic treat as the smell of childhood overwhelms the senses. The grill is the only thing cooking, so there are no fries, only chips. There is a wide selection of non-alcoholic beverages to complement your meal. I often order two and take one with me, once the appetite is piqued, it often takes a second to satiate! This cinder-block diner is a bit hard to find, look for the hand-painted king on the side and make certain that you're not parking in someone else's lot. Highly recommended, never know who you're going to see!

data.title: Best hamburger in the whole wide world
data.text: Before there was a Five Guys or a Smashburger or a BurgerFi, there was Hamburger King. Fresh ingredients, delicious ground beef, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, dill pickle. It doesn't get any better!

data.title: Hambugers, all Hamburgers
data.text: Do not go here if you are dieting, but if you want one of the best hamburgers in America, pull over.  All burgers are made to order, but just let them make their standard burger.  I don't like too many onions or much mustard, this burger has both, but I love it.  They make hot dogs, I've never had them.  They also make a ham sandwich, which is just like the hamburger but with ham instead of ground beef, and it is excellent.  No fries, chips available.  Soft Drinks are in a can. There is no décor.  Most people use the take-out window.

data.title: Awesome burger!
data.text: Best burger in Alabama for sure! Staff was friendly. Prices were cheap for the amount of food. No fries. You won't miss them. Chips and drinks available.  The deluxe was huge and juicy and a flavor explosion.  Simple fresh and perfect. This is a must stop when in the area. Only open for lunch.

data.title: Heading back to Louisiana
data.text:
I attended my niece graduation in Atlanta.  We are heading back to Baton Rouge and was approaching Mobile around 7:30am, when a hunger pain hit.  I checked the reviews for Hamburger King on Trip Advisor and said, "Let's try here."

We ordered two deluxe hambugers.  They were delicious!  They were homemade and all fresh ingredients. Plus they make hambugers from 7am until they close.

They are conveniently located near the Interstate, fast and friendly service and a walk up window to boot.  I will be back!

data.title: WOW! What a burger!!
data.text: The Cheeseburger Deluxe was the best burger that I have eaten in a while!  Quick service, but busy! It is awesome for a quick lunch!

data.title: Alot like mom's
data.text: Nice hand pattied burgers just like mom used to make. Fresh toppings that you can taste in every bite.  The downside is there's a bit if a wait most hours open but you cant rush quality. Burgers are about $6 and hotdogs about $2.50. If in a hurry suggest calling order in but it is an experience.

data.title: Hole in the wall GOOD!
data.text: This place was recommended by a local friend, and boy was the burger GOOD! They make their own patties and cut the veggies along with your order fresh! And the bread literally melts in your mouth with each bite so soft. If they were grass-fed organic beef this place would have me here eating EVERYDAY, lol. Meanwhile a little cheating won't kill me :P If curious, do stop and have a burger!

data.title: Good find while on the road.
data.text: Busy little local place with wonderful burgers.  Worth a small departure off of the interstate.  Oder at the counter and they'll call you when it is ready.  Limited menu with quick service.  Will go back when in the area.

data.title: Hole-in-the-wall place with great burgers!
data.text:
On a recent trip south, our lunch stop on the third day was in Montgomery, AL.  

Based on Internet reviews, we chose the Hamburger King.  No, not Burger King.  Hamburger King is a mom-and-pop “hole-in-the-wall” type place.  They can seat eight or ten on stools around the counter plus maybe twenty at small tables.  

They mainly sell burgers; their menu did list hot dogs and egg sandwiches.  “No fries, chips.”  (Where have I heard that before?)  The burgers were excellent.  While I can’t place them into my “Top Five” category, they were very good - We’d stop here again without a doubt.

The place is not far from Maxwell Air Base which accounts for the majority of the folk eating there being USAF personnel during the first half of our stay.  I must say, I had never seen so many young enlisted people having E-8 and E-9 rank patches.  But that probably says more about me than it does them.

With tax: only $14.75.

data.title: Excellent burgers made to order. Worth the wait
data.text: A co-worker introduced me to this place. I have to share. Great local gem. Food is simple and delicious. Choice of burger with any of the usual toppings. You cant go wrong with a cheeseburger with everything on it. Burger and bun size is legit! Add a bag of chips and a root-beer to make a great lunch for under $10.

data.title: HAMBURGERS
data.text: These burgers are so good ithey are worth the price and the waith time because they are cooked to ordered.

data.title: Best Hamburger
data.text: While visiting Montgomery historical sites with my daughter and her young son and daughter, we were looking for a place to have lunch. We saw Hamburger King was rated #7, and since our grandson wanted a hamburger, we decided to try it. It was in the downtown area close to the Capital Building. The building was old, and small, and inside very simple basic bar with stools and a few tables. They only took cash, but had an ATM inside. They were super busy. Their main item was the hamburgers. We ordered ours all the way, and it was absolutely the best and biggest hamburger I have ever eaten! They have other items on the menu, but no fries. They have chips to go with your burger. Would definitely go back if I am in Montgomery again.

data.title: Best Burgers in Montgomery
data.text: I'm a local, but work out of town, so I only get to eat here 3 or 4 times a year.  I've learned to arrive early and no later than 10:30.  The owners love to visit while you wait.  Once the burger arrives, you wont be disappointed.  There's not a lot of side items, but make sure to get an ice cold IBC root beer and a frozen Snickers.

data.title: This was great.....
data.text:
I would say ignore the bad reviews. 

This was a tasty burger and ice cold drink.  

They serve burgers and do it well. 

We would come back again and again but are just passing through. 

It beats the hell out of anything back home in Perth Australia. 

We were here at lunch on a Thursdsy and had no problem getting a seat at the cocunter. 

Good job gang!

data.title: Hamburger King Never Disappoints!
data.text: Whenever I go to Montgomery on business, I like to eat lunch at Hamburger King on Decatur St.  I ate there on a Monday around 12:30 pm and once again enjoyed my lunch.  I ordered the Cheeseburger "all the way", and it was cooked just right and was very juicy!  Be sure and get plenty of napkins as the burger can be messy.  They do not accept credit cards.  The wait was not too long, but I sat at a table and read a book while I waited.  I am looking forward to eating there again!
